skillTree.localised_description: As it turns out, the more important the murder, the more likely they are to be carrying something worth 'appropriating'.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.

effects.description: Spell resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Gristl learned to survive by having enemies stab at where he wasn't, and as he's ascended the leadership of Clan Treecherik, he's only gotten better at not being where everyone thinks he is.

effects.description: Ability: "Look-look Over There"

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Gristl Twitchslice

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a fleeing back is the best sight in the world for a rat of Clan Treecherik.

effects.description: Ability: "Strike-stab Now-now"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.

skillTree.localised_name: Eyes in the Back of My Head
skillTree.localised_description: The rats of Clan Treecherik learn to see behind, above, and below them, although exactly how they manage this feat is uncertain.

effects.description: Ability: "Eyes in the Back of My Head"

unit_ability.onscreen_name: Eyes in the Back of My Head

skillTree.localised_description: Clan Treecherik are a violent, undisciplined mob more used to stabbing their kin down a dark side burrow than facing surface dwellers. However, the group are well practised in stealth tactics and striking from the shadows.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 during subterranean intercept battles
	(all units in army)

Melee attack: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: A lifetime in Clan Treecherik has taught Gristl that anything he can do to stay alive, he has to do. Otherwise a knife is coming for his neck.

effects.description: Ability: "Duck and Weave"

skillTree.localised_description: Perhaps the underlings of Clan Treecherik have finally moved past their vile, backstabbing ways. At least while you're looking at them, anyway.

effects.description:
Remove ability: "Stay 'way! Stab-Kill!"
	(all units in army)

Leadership: +6
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Gristl has gotten so good at not being where people think he is that even his shadows can stab people in the back, if anyone is foolish enough to turn away.

effects.description: Ability: "Murder-kill You-you!"

ui_effects.localised_text: Creates an image of Gristl Twitchslice

skillTree.localised_description: Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +3
Weapon strength: +4%

skillTree.localised_description: As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +2%
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +5%
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.

effects.description: Armour: +7
Armour: +15

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

effects.description: Leadership: +6
Leadership: +12

skillTree.localised_description: Make no mistake – in most cases, a Master Assassin’s training is quite literally a baptism of fire.

effects.description: Hit points: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.

effects.description: Speed: +7%
Speed: +15%
Ability: "Assassin's Trophy"

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being the leader of Clan Treecherik is an unwelcome position in most ways, but Gristl intends to use it to his benefit - stabbing friends in the back and moving in to their lair.
